attributes.comment:
I oppose the increase in fees for adoption petitions (I-600A and I-600),
fingerprinting and Certificates of Citizenship. The fees are already high and with
the short time frames in which approvals are valid (18 months for I-600A and 15
months for fingerprints), many families have to file twice to complete a single
adoption.

Here is what it costs to file with USCIS for a couple just to adopt:

What it used to be when adoptions took place within 18 months:

I600A: $545

Fingerprints: $70 x 2 = $140

Total: $685

What it will be now that adoptions are taking longer plus the increase:

I600A: $670 x 2 = $1340

Fingerprints: $80 x 4 = $ 320

Total: $1660

That's an increase of $975 or over 140%!

On top of those fees, once the child is home, the cost of a Certificate of
Citizenship is already high at $215 and is slated to increase to $460, a difference
of $245 or about 120% increase.

These fee increases will affect thousands of people who are already hemorrhaging
cash to pay for an adoption, some after years of infertility treatments. Please do
not raise these fees!

Thank you.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Nanci Gabbard
